title: What is your opinion of the Oxford Comma? Do you strongly defend your position when necessary? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nobody has “an opinion” about the Oxford comma. You use it (or omit it) depending on the policy of the company you’re writing for. If you’re writing on your own, it’s your choice. My husband has been writing for a newspaper for the past 22 years. I type all his columns. I omit the Oxford comma because newspapers don’t use it. On the other hand, I write books - and most publishers want the Oxford comma. I use it when I type my own manuscripts. That’s what professional writers do. They adjust their practices according to the situation. They don’t have a “position” about it that they feel obliged to “defend.”
